alert.note: Alert for Merced (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 6:26PM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Stevinson affecting Merced County. .The Merced River at Stevinson will fluctuate around flood stage into the foreseeable future. High flows along the Merced River at Stevinson will be dangerous through at least this weekend. For the Merced River...including Stevinson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Stevinson. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 69.0 feet, The playground area in Hagaman Park along Highway 165 is flooded. At 70.5 feet, Water is up to the maintenance building in Hagaman Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Friday the stage was 70.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to 71.1 feet tomorrow afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 71.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 71.4 feet on 03/21/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Location Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm PDT) -------- Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Merced River Stevinson 71.0 70.7 Fri 8 am PDT 70.7 70.9 70.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 900 AM PDT.
